reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of full package of WASH services to most vulnerable IDPs and host communities in NW Syria

description.narrative: Maram Foundation seeks to save lives, uphold rights, and promote access to key institutions and services through providing WASH services in particular. So, MF in Turkey office is remotely managing the delivery of integrated WASH assistance with main-streamed protection and advocacy in Idleb. Basic WASH assistance is delivered to the targeted community by taking into account the different needs of men, women, boys, and girls, in addition, taking into consideration the special needs of disabled people in all the project activities, especially during the infrastructure designs. Therefore, Maram applied for the SCHF 2nd standard allocation to provide 74,138 beneficiaries, 14,323 households (HHs) living in Idleb Governorate in seven communities (Orm Eljoz, Janudiyeh, Darkosh, Motaram, Al-Hafriya, Ramadiyeh, and Ghazala - Mgheidleh) and seven camps (Omran, Al Shaheed Maher Kujak, Basmat Amal(Zarzur), Alrbye, Altal Al'akhdar, Tajamoa Mizreh, and Al Hayat ) with basic WASH services including solid waste removal, Rehabilitation/reactivation of WASH facilities, Construction of latrines, showers, and regular emptying of septic tanks, de-sludging latrine septic tanks, solid waste management, garbage bins distribution, an extension of Sanitation network in communities, in addition to solid waste management in 7 communities The proposed project is targetting communities and IDPs camps as follow: - Seven communities are located in (Ariha, Janudiyeh, and Darkosh subdistricts) in the prioritized locations based on the 2021 2nd Allocation paper. - Seven camps are located in two main sub-district (Janudiyeh, Darkosh) The project design was done according to SPHERE standards and WASH guidance in line with current SCHF allocation priorities where all the proposed activities in this project are according to the need assessment which was conducted by Maram on November 2021(Annex 01) and in coordinating with WASH cluster and several NGOs. The planned intervention will mainstream protection principles especially (Do no harm) throughout the project cycle by considering the different needs of men, women, young children, children, adolescents, young adults, middle-aged adults, and older adults. The provision of sanitation services (latrines, washing facilities, etc.) will be consulted with the targeted camps and communities, and take into account the specific needs of each group. Implementation plan: - Maram will hold coordination meetings with the targeted camps management and local councils to explain Maram's WASH intervention, update the needs and IDPs numbers. - Regarding the daily activities (septic tank de-sludging, garbage collection..etc) all PRs will be prepared after signing the GA and before starting the project in order to start providing the services at the beginning of the project period - While for the technical studies (rehab sanitation network...etc) all the tenders will be prepared after starting the project according to Maram's policy. - Furthermore, during the project life, monitoring will be conducted at every stage of the project duration by collecting routine data and analysis on a continuous basis, in addition to evaluating the services provided by Maram to evaluate the service and find out how it met the needs of beneficiaries of different ages.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
